title: Watch: Hilarious 'Godfart' - A Scientifically-Accurate 2 Min Short Film
description: And then God said, let there be farts! And thus the universe was born. This hilarious 2-minute short film is now online for everyone to enjoy. Godfart is the bonkers creation of comedy filmmaker Michael Langan. He's be whipping up films, commercials, music videos and more but this takes the cake. From the universe of Doxology comes Godfart, the epic creation myth that traces the origins of everything to God's quest for breakfast. Russel Hodgkinson stars as God - before he could make the universe, he needed something to eat first. And the rest is history... Literally. Even though this may seem like a simple concept to pull off, it's not as easy as it looks. To find the right guy for the role of God, to make it all seem plausible and hilarious, and to bring it together with that big bang finale – as the Italians say, that's amore. Plug your nose & enjoy. Thanks to Short of the Week for the tip on this funny short landing online. Brief intro from YouTube: "In the beginning, God was hungry - An amusing take on how the universe was created, starting with God's quest for breakfast." Godfart is written […]
author: Alex Billington
excerpt: And then God said, let there be farts! And thus the universe was born. This hilarious 2-minute short film is now online for everyone to enjoy. text: SHORT FILMS by December 16, 2024Source: YouTube And then God said, let there be farts! And thus the universe was born. This hilarious 2-minute short film is now online for everyone to enjoy. Godfart is the bonkers creation of comedy filmmaker Michael Langan. He's be whipping up films, commercials, music videos and more but this takes the cake. From the universe of Doxology comes Godfart, the epic creation myth that traces the origins of everything to God's quest for breakfast. Russel Hodgkinson stars as God - before he could make the universe, he needed something to eat first. And the rest is history... Literally. Even though this may seem like a simple concept to pull off, it's not as easy as it looks. To find the right guy for the role of God, to make it all seem plausible and hilarious, and to bring it together with that big bang finale – as the Italians say, that's amore. Plug your nose & enjoy. Thanks to Short of the Week for the tip on this funny short landing online. Brief intro from YouTube: "In the beginning, God was hungry - An amusing take on how the universe was created, starting with God's quest for breakfast." Godfart is written and directed by funky indie filmmaker Michael Langan who "lives on a raincloud in Seattle" - you can view more of his work on his Vimeo page or visit his official website or follow him on IG @langanfilms. He's also worked with Reggie Watts, Iris Van Herpen, Brett Gelman, and Eugene Lee Yang previously. Produced by Jonathan Caso. With cinematography by Chris Mosson. This short also premiered at the Fantastic Fest 2024 a few months ago. Originally made for Adult Swim. For more info on the film, visit YouTube or Langan's website. To enjoy more shorts click here. Is this how it really happened? Find more posts in: Comedy, Short Film, To Watch prev next
html:
SHORT FILMS

by
December 16, 2024
Source: YouTube

And then God said, let there be farts! And thus the universe was born. This hilarious 2-minute short film is now online for everyone to enjoy. Godfart is the bonkers creation of comedy filmmaker Michael Langan. He's be whipping up films, commercials, music videos and more but this takes the cake. From the universe of Doxology comes Godfart, the epic creation myth that traces the origins of everything to God's quest for breakfast. Russel Hodgkinson stars as God - before he could make the universe, he needed something to eat first. And the rest is history... Literally. Even though this may seem like a simple concept to pull off, it's not as easy as it looks. To find the right guy for the role of God, to make it all seem plausible and hilarious, and to bring it together with that big bang finale – as the Italians say, that's amore. Plug your nose & enjoy.

Thanks to Short of the Week for the tip on this funny short landing online. Brief intro from YouTube: "In the beginning, God was hungry - An amusing take on how the universe was created, starting with God's quest for breakfast." Godfart is written and directed by funky indie filmmaker Michael Langan who "lives on a raincloud in Seattle" - you can view more of his work on his Vimeo page or visit his official website or follow him on IG @langanfilms. He's also worked with Reggie Watts, Iris Van Herpen, Brett Gelman, and Eugene Lee Yang previously. Produced by Jonathan Caso. With cinematography by Chris Mosson. This short also premiered at the Fantastic Fest 2024 a few months ago. Originally made for Adult Swim. For more info on the film, visit YouTube or Langan's website. To enjoy more shorts click here. Is this how it really happened?
